awd_titl_txt: SHF: Small: Developing a Highly Efficient and Accurate Approximation System for Warehouse-Scale Computers with the Sub-dataset Distribution Aware Approach
awd_abstract_narration:
Despite the fact that today's warehouse-scale computers supply enormous data processing capacity, getting an ad-hoc query answer from a big dataset remains challenging. To attack the problem, recent years have seen one trend to exploit approximate computing to achieve faster execution on a much smaller sample of the original data by sacrificing result accuracy to a reasonable extent. Both offline based sampling approaches and online cluster sampling solutions have been gradually deployed in a real world to accelerate big data query. Educational benefits arise from broadening the experience of students from a top ranked Hispanic Ph.D. degree awarding institution and enhanced computer science/engineering curriculum activities. The online cross-institution undergraduate elective course about warehouse-scale computer and big data will be helpful in providing a re-imagined learning experience that makes optimum use of today's technologies supplemented by a broad range of media-rich study materials that students from three different universities.
 
There are major difficulties in developing an integrated hardware and software, scalable approximation system.  The main challenge is to minimize the total size of accessed data and its associative I/O overhead subject to a given error bound. Existing popular cluster sampling with equal probability solutions do not deal well with many real-world applications following a non-uniform distribution. This research aims to tackle those challenges by investigating new sub-dataset distribution aware methods to capture sub-dataset distributions especially for non-uniform types, applying cluster sampling with unequal probability to address the inefficient sampling and large variance problem caused by non-uniform sub-dataset distribution, and taking into account the unique properties of sampling process to match with the computer hardware features, such as SSD arrays to unleash their full potential. The research will ensure future big data approximation system enables high velocity of big-data analytics to revolutionize the way that people interact with the world; and high productivity improvement of the economic impact through the efficient and effective data processing.

por.por_cntn:
Title: Enhancing Data Processing Efficiency: A Breakthrough in Sampling-based Approximation

Introduction: We are excited to share the outcomes of our research project that aimed to revolutionize data processing efficiency in warehouse-scale computers. Over the course of our project, we successfully developed an innovative approximation system called Sapprox and an architecture-aware sampling library called ArchSampler. These advancements have significant intellectual merit and broader impacts in the field of data analytics and computer systems.

Intellectual Merit: Our research project made significant contributions to the intellectual merit of sampling-based approximation. We developed Sapprox, a distribution-aware method that efficiently collects occurrences of sub-datasets in a distributed system. By leveraging this information, Sapprox facilitates online sampling and improves the accuracy and efficiency of data processing. We also applied cluster sampling with unequal probability theory to implement a distribution-aware sampling method, addressing the challenges posed by non-uniform sub-dataset distribution.

Furthermore, we quantitatively derived the optimal sampling unit size in a distributed file system, considering both approximation costs and accuracy. This novel approach enables researchers and practitioners to determine the ideal sampling unit size, leading to improved performance in data analysis tasks. Additionally, our proposal of ArchSampler, an architecture-aware sampling library, addresses performance slowdowns observed in existing implementations. ArchSampler intelligently selects the most suitable memory bank to serve requests, enhancing data locality and reducing contentions.

Broader Impacts: Our project has far-reaching impacts on the broader scientific community and society as a whole. By improving the efficiency and accuracy of data processing, we empower researchers, data scientists, and businesses to gain valuable insights from large datasets more effectively. The outcomes of our research have practical implications in various domains, including finance, healthcare, transportation, and environmental monitoring.

The development and open-source release of Sapprox as part of the Hadoop ecosystem offer a readily available tool for researchers and practitioners to incorporate into their data processing pipelines. This democratization of advanced approximation techniques promotes collaboration and accelerates advancements in the field.

ArchSampler, our architecture-aware sampling library, plays a pivotal role in unlocking the full potential of emerging technologies such as in-memory computing. By intelligently leveraging the unique features of modern hardware architectures, ArchSampler significantly enhances the performance of in-memory applications. This advancement has implications for diverse areas, including real-time data analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, leading to faster and more accurate decision-making.

Throughout the project, we have actively engaged with the research community through presentations at conferences and publications in academic journals. By sharing our findings, methodologies, and open-source implementations, we aim to inspire further research and foster collaborations that push the boundaries of data processing efficiency.

Conclusion: In conclusion, our research project has successfully addressed the intellectual merit and broader impacts of advancing sampling-based approximation in warehouse-scale computers. The development of Sapprox and ArchSampler has significantly improved the efficiency and accuracy of data processing, empowering researchers and businesses to extract insights from large datasets more effectively. These breakthroughs have practical implications across various domains, driving innovation and progress in data analytics. By sharing our findings and open-source implementations, we hope to inspire future research and foster collaboration in the pursuit of efficient and impactful data processing techniques.

 


Last Modified: 06/20/2023
Modified by: Jun Wang
